intro: Meconella, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. These plants are native to various regions of Africa and are characterized by their showy, often colorful flowers. Meconella species typically have opposite, ovate leaves and produce capsule-like fruits that contain toxic seeds. The plant contains milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature and can be irritant to the skin. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
